document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Nosphistica Meyrick, 1911 (Lepidoptera Lecithoceridae) from China, with descriptions of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Nosphistica Meyrick, 1911 (Lepidoptera Lecithoceridae) from China, with descriptions of seven new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Athymoris paramecola Wu, 1996: 307
. TL: China ( Hainan Province ). TD: IZCAS.

Diagnosis. Adult ( Fig. 16 ) wingspan 12.0–16.0 mm. In the female genitalia this species is characterized by the presence of a colliculum, and the uniform ductus bursae coiled anteriorly and nearly 3× length of the corpus bursae ( Fig. 37 ). It is superficially similar to
N. effrenata ( Meyrick, 1918 )
, but it can be distinguished from the latter by the forewing with M 3 absent, and in the male genitalia by the sub-rectangular valva ( Fig. 29 ); in
N. effrenata
, the venation M 3 of the forewing is present, and the valva is broad basally and narrowed distally ( Clarke 1965: 206 , Pl. 103, Fig. 1 ).
Distribution. China ( Guangxi , Hainan , Taiwan , Zhejiang).
